description: This course introduces midwifery students to the history and identity of the midwifery profession. They will be exposed to a variety of media outlining the unique role of the midwife and how that role has adapted to meet women's needs and embrace the emerging evidence supporting midwifery models of care.The midwives role in promoting health in pregnancy during the antenatal period will be covered The physiological focus of teaching will be the maternal and fetal respiratory system.
restricted: B. Mid or BN/B Mid. students
